sen.j: たんばとは、西日本旅客鉄道が京都駅～福知山駅間を山陰本線経由で運行する特別急行列車。
sen.e: "Tanba" is the name of a limited express train that West Japan Railway Company (JR West) operates between Kyot Station and Fukuchiyama Station via San'in Main Line.
"Tanba" is the name of a limited express train that the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) operates between Kyoto Station and Fukuchiyama Station via the San'in Main Line.
"Tanba" is the name of a limited express train that the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) operates between Kyoto Station and Fukuchiyama Station via the Sanin Main Line.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。

sen.j: 北近畿ビッグXネットワークを形成する列車の1つである。
sen.e: This train is one of those used in the north kinki big X network. Kinosakionsen Station.
This train is one of those used in the North Kinki Big X Network's Kinosakionsen Station.
This train is one of those used in the North Kinki Big X Network.
sen.cmt: 不要な単語を削除しました。

sen.j: 臨時列車として、福知山以西、城崎温泉駅まで延長運転されることもある。
sen.e: This train is sometimes operated as a special train with its operation extened to the west of Fukuchiyama, up to Kinosakionsen Station.
This train is sometimes operated as a special train with its operation extended to the west of Fukuchiyama, up to Kinosakionsen Station.
This train is sometimes operated as a special train with its operation extended to the west of Fukuchiyama, up to Kinosakionsen Station.

sen.j: 特急「まいづる (列車)」との京都・綾部間の併結運転をするものが多い。
sen.e: This train is often operated between Kyoto and Ayabe connected with "Maizuru (a limited express train)."
This train is often operated between Kyoto and Ayabe, being connected with "Maizuru," a limited express train.
This train is often operated between Kyoto and Ayabe, being connected with 'Maizuru (train)' a limited express train.

sen.j: 通勤特急的な役割並びに、但馬方面から京都方面へのリレー的要素を担っている。
sen.e: This train plays the roles of a commuter limited express train and of relaying passengers from the Tajima area to the Kyot area.
This train serves as a commuter limited express as well as a train that relays passengers from the Tajima area to the Kyoto area.
This train serves as a commuter limited express as well as a train that relays passengers from the Tajima area to the Kyoto area.

sen.j: イメージカラーは青色。
sen.e: Its image color is blue.
Its color theme is blue.
Its color theme is blue.

sen.j: とにかく目的地がJR西日本の支社所在地なので、そのコーポレートカラーにちなんでいる。
sen.e: Since its destinations are places where branch offices of JR West are located, its color is associated with the coporate color.
Because its destinations are places where branch offices of JR West are located, its color is associated with the corporate color.
Because its destinations are places where branch offices of JR West are located, its color is associated with the corporate color.

General operating conditions

Maximum speed

sen.j: 京都駅～福知山駅間 120km/h
sen.e: 120 km/h between Kyoto Station and Fukuchiyama Station
The train reaches a speed of 120 km/h between Kyoto Station and Fukuchiyama Station
The train reaches a speed of 120 km/h between Kyoto Station and Fukuchiyama Station

sen.j: 編成
sen.e: Organization
Organization
Organization

sen.j: ■枠＝グリーン車 白枠＝普通車 (鉄道車両) 自＝自由席 指＝座席指定席 ※全車両禁煙
sen.e: ■ frame = a first-class car, white frame = an ordinary-class car, 自＝nonreserved seats, 指＝reserved seats; * Smoking is prohibited in all of the cars.
■ Frame = a first-class car, white frame = an ordinary-class car, 自＝non-reserved seats, 指＝reserved seats; * Smoking is prohibited in all of the cars.
Frame = a first-class car, white frame = an ordinary-class car, 自＝non-reserved seats, 指＝reserved seats; * Smoking is prohibited in all of the cars.

sen.j: この編成はたんば1・3・5・7・4・6・8号の編成
sen.e: This organization is for Tanba 1, 3, 5, 7, 4, 6 and 8.
This organizational system is for Tanba 1, 3, 5, 7, 4, 6 and 8.
This organizational system is for Tanba 1, 3, 5, 7, 4, 6 and 8.

sen.j: 1～4がたんばの編成
sen.e: 1 to 4 is for Tanba
Numbers 1 to 4 are for Tanba.
Numbers 1 to 4 are for Tanba.

sen.j: 5～7がまいづるの編成
sen.e: 5 to 7 is for Mizuru.
Numbers 5 to 7 are for Mizuru.
Numbers 5 to 7 are for Maizuru.

sen.j: この編成はたんば9・2号の編成
sen.e: This organization for Tanba 9 and 2.
This organizational system is for Tanba 9 and 2.
This organizational system is for Tanba 9 and 2.

tit.e: The stations where this train stops
Stations at which the train stops
Stations at which the train stops

sen.j: 京都駅 - 二条駅 - 亀岡駅 - 園部駅 - (日吉駅 (京都府)) - (胡麻駅) - (和知駅) - 綾部駅 - 福知山駅
sen.e: Kyoto Station - Nijo Station - Kameoka Station - Sonobe Station - (Hiyoshi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)) - (Goma Station) - (Wachi Station) - Ayabe Station - Fukuchiyama Station
Kyoto Station - Nijo Station - Kameoka Station - Sonobe Station - (Hiyoshi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)) - (Goma Station) - (Wachi Station) - Ayabe Station - Fukuchiyama Station
Kyoto Station - Nijo Station - Kameoka Station - Sonobe Station - (Hiyoshi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)) - (Goma Station) - (Wachi Station) - Ayabe Station - Fukuchiyama Station

sen.j: ()内の駅は一部列車停車。
sen.e: Some of the Tanba trains stop at the stations in the bracket ().
Some of the Tanba trains stop at the stations shown in brackets ([]).
Some of the Tanba trains stop at the stations shown in brackets ([]).

sen.j: 名称の由来及び沿革
sen.e: The reason whey the name was given and its history
The reason the name was given, and its history
The origin of the name and history

sen.j: 「たんば」の名称はいわゆる旧国名（令制国）の丹波国にちなむ。
sen.e: The name of "Tanba" originates in Tanba Province that was used as so-called a province name in the nationn's governing system in old days
The name "Tanba" originated from Tanba Province, which was used as a so-called provincial name in the nation's governing system in the old days.
The name 'Tanba' originated from Tanba Province, which was used as a so-called provincial name in the nation's governing system in the old days.

sen.j: その為、その地域を指す京都府北部・兵庫県北東部を目的地としている列車名に用いられた。
sen.e: Therefore, this name was used for the train whose destination is the area covering the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture and the nort-eastern part of Hyogo Prefecture, the area indicated by the name.

Therefore, this name was used for the train whose destination was the area covering the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture and the northeastern part of Hyogo Prefecture, this being the area indicated by the name.

Therefore, this name was used for the train whose destination was the area covering the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture and the northeastern part of Hyogo Prefecture, this being the area indicated by the name.

sen.j: そのため、現行のそれの前に1960年より1986年まで大阪駅～城崎駅（現：城崎温泉駅）間を福知山線・山陰本線・舞鶴線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線経由で運行する準急列車・急行列車「丹波」（たんば）が運行されていた。
sen.e: Therefore, before the new Tango train started its operation, a semi-express train and express train named Tango were operated in 1960 to 1986 between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station (present Kinosakionsen Station) via Fukuchiyama Line, San'in Main Line, Maizuru Lin,e and Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation

Accordingly, before the new Tango train started operations a semi-express train and express train, each called Tango, were operated during the period of 1960 to 1986 between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station (presently Kinosakionsen Station) via the Fukuchiyama Line, San'in Main Line, Maizuru Line and Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation.

Accordingly, before the new Tanba train started operations a semi-express train and express train, each called Tanba, were operated during the period of 1960 to 1986 between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station (presently Kinosakionsen Station) via the Fukuchiyama Line, Sanin Main Line, Maizuru Line and Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation.
sen.cmt: Tango→ Tanba に修正しました。

sen.j: &amprarr北近畿 (列車)戦後の展開も参照されたい。
sen.e: Also refer to the after-war development of the &amprarr Kita-Kinki train
sen.cmt: 意味が理解できませんでしたので、字句通り訳してあります。
sen.e: Also refer to the postwar development of the Kita-Kinki train.
Also refer to the postwar development of the Kita-Kinki (train).
sen.cmt: train をカッコ内に入れました。

sen.j: 1996年、山陰本線園部駅～福知山駅間電化により、急行「きのさき_(列車)」を電車化。
sen.e: In 1996, electric operation of trains started between Sonobe Station and Fukuchiyam on San'in Main Line, and electric cars were introduced in the "Kinosak" express train.
In 1996, the electric operation of trains started between Sonobe Station and Fukuchiyama on the San'in Main Line, and electric cars were introduced in the "Kinosaka" express train.
1996: The electric operation of trains started between Sonobe Station and Fukuchiyama Station on the Sanin Main Line, and electric cars were introduced in the 'Kinosaki (train)' express train.
sen.cmt: Fukuchiyama Station としました。Kinosaki に修正しました。

sen.j: 福知山駅発着列車についてこの名称とする。
sen.e: This name is used for trains starting from and returning to Fukuchiyama Station.
This name is used for trains starting from and returning to Fukuchiyama Station.
This name is used for trains arriving at and departing from Fukuchiyama Station.
sen.cmt: "starting from and returning to"→"arriving at and departing from"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1999年、特急「きのさき (列車)」の増発により、上り列車のみ運行を中止。
sen.e: When the number of times the "Kinosaki" limited express train operated was increased in 1999, its up-train operation alone was terminated.
Consequent upon the 1999 increase in the number of times the "Kinosaki" limited express train operated, its up-train operation was terminated.
1999: Consequently increase in the number of times the 'Kinosaki (train)' limited express train operated, its inbound train operation was terminated.

sen.j: 2003年、特急「まいづる (列車)」運行開始により、併結列車として上り列車運転復活。
sen.e: When the operation of the "Maizuru" limited express train started in 2003, up-train operation of Tango was restored in the organiztion that the up-train was connected with the "Maizuru" train.

When the operation of the "Maizuru" limited express train started in 2003, the up-train operation of Tango was restored in the organization by which the up-train was connected with the "Maizuru" train.

2003: When the operation of the 'Maizuru (train)' limited express train started, the inbound train operation of Tanba was restored in the organization by which the inbound train was connected with the 'Maizuru' train.

sen.j: 2007年3月18日、全面禁煙化を実施。
sen.e: Since March 18, smoking in the train has been prohibited totally.
Since March 18, smoking has been prohibited throughout the train.
March 18, 2007: smoking was prohibited throughout the train.
